website_summaries.verdict: For an inexpensive Bluetooth speaker, the Tribit XSound Go is hard to beat.
pros: The Tribit XSound Go is a budget-priced Bluetooth speaker that sounds good for its size and price
It's attractively designed and is waterproof
cons: It has trouble with complicated tracks
There's some bass, just not a lot

customer_reviews.title: Although base was good. Oontz 3 plus sound was very clear but ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried Anker, Oontz and Tribit. Compared all of them. Anker sound seems to be nasally congested. Although base was good. Oontz 3 plus sound was very clear but base was not strong enough. This lil speaker from Tribit has excellent sound, amazing base with pleasing clarity. I can simply say, it competes with bose mini portable speaker. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: SY

customer_reviews.title: Last Two Weeks
customer_reviews.text: Speakers started sounding fuzzy and rattling within two weeks and I never had the volume up less than two notches from silent. It sat on my bathroom counter the entire time.
customer_reviews.author: ZPT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Trips and Outdoor Hangouts
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect accessory for hanging out with friends - I easily packed it in my bag for a weekend trip to San Francisco and it was the best part of our day at Dolores Park. Setting it up on anyone's phone is really simple and the sound quality is fantastic. I'd definitely suggest this for anyone looking for a simple setup, great sound quality and easy portability.
customer_reviews.author: Momthree3

customer_reviews.title: Not for rock music
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product for the following 2 reasons: -Not good for rock music. It produces constant buzzing when playing song with guitar sounds with distortion/overdrive. -When using the Bluetooth communication there is delay with respect the source signal, so it's not good for watching videos/movies unless you use an aux cable.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Firmware update included
customer_reviews.text: Great speaker, great price, and great customer service. Just so you know, the speakers being shipped now contain the firmware upgrade spoken about in older reviews. I asked the company's customer service how to update the firmware and they wrote back quickly telling me it's already in the speakers being shipped now. Highly recommended! I have been using the speaker and am pleased with it and recommend it! Great sound!
customer_reviews.author: bae2007

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong with this one!
customer_reviews.text: I’m really impressed with this little speaker! I didn’t want to spend a ton of money since I wasn’t sure if I would use it often, but now I’m finding that it’s always on! The sound quality is surprisingly good for such a small and relatively inexpensive speaker. The volume has great range- my kids enjoy turning it up as loud as it will go and having dance parties in the kitchen. The depth of sound is pretty great too. I plug mine in frequently, so I haven’t really tested out the battery life. But if you’re on the fence, I can solidly recommend this one. Just do it!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Manolis

customer_reviews.title: Big Sound From A Little Guy!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Hard to believe the sound quality out of this little baby! I bought it to replace my UE Megaboom which died after 4 years. I have an email into UE and they insisted a representative would be in touch within 48 hours. That was 6 days ago but enough about that. The sound quality of the Tribit isn’t quite as good as my Megaboom but again, the Boom was $200. I would definitely recommend this little guy. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kinzel

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Portable Speakers under $50
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of searching for an affordable yet decent sounding portable speaker and Tribit has successfully delivered. This speaker is far better than some of the other affordable, high-ranking speakers on Amazon (like Oontz Angle, Anker Soundcore, Doss Touch). The sound is richer, deeper, and has good bass without sounding forced or over the top. It's even on par with some $50 or $60 speakers on Amazon. Top that off with the fact that it's waterproof, has an insane battery life and a long range, and you have an awesome product well worth the price. If you're comparing this to other speakers under $50, stop looking! This is definitely what you should get.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Honestly for the money this has been a great speaker. I was really surprised at how loud it can go as well as how good it sounded for being on the cheaper end. If you are looking for a great, easy to use, and just the right features, this is a good option. Synced up with the phone with no issues. Not to heavy but also doesn't feel cheap. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Britney Mecham

customer_reviews.title: Won't charge!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this speaker when I first got it!!! The sound quality was great and it held the charge for many days with a lot of use. Unfortunately, the speaker won't hold a charge, so I can no longer use it. I'm having to return it because no matter what I try, the speaker cant re-charge. I'm really disappointed as the other reviews I read made the product seem so fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up
customer_reviews.text: Did not hold up. Amazing sound for about a week. Then heavy vibration when bass player. Tried recharging twice . Helped some but still unpleasant to listen to due to vibration. Tribit reached out and offered free replacement but I decided to try different product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Coley

customer_reviews.title: This speaker rocks!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This speaker rocks!!!!!! It pairs in seconds & sounds great!!!!! It really helps me, because I'm losing hearing in one ear, but at the same time I'm also extremely sensitive to sound & this Tribit gives out such a rich sound, that it doesn't hurt my ear. I can now hear much better on my phone, etc. Love it!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BellaD

customer_reviews.title: What a great speaker!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous sound for its size and price. Compact, yet seemingly very sturdy (no, I have not dropped it on my tile floor, yet). Easily and quickly paired with my Google Pixel. And now that it's a "trusted" device, turning it on almost immediately plays my music if I have my bluetooth active. Love managing music and volume form either device. Haven't tested how long a single charge lasts. Gave a friend a demonstration because I was/am so impressed and he ordered one for himself that evening. I simply have not found a reason to be dissatisfied with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Scott London

customer_reviews.title: The truth.
customer_reviews.text: I have compared this to my Bose SoundLink Micro and can honestly report that this speaker sounds better. Well worth it. Put it a few inches from a wall and enjoy the bass. Oh, and the charging led is purple if charging while playing! How cool is that?
customer_reviews.author: P. Bridgman

customer_reviews.title: performance
customer_reviews.text: Don't sell your Klipshorns, this won't replace them but it does an amazing job for it's size. Pros: It easily paired with all my bluetooth devices, it works perfectly in all areas of my home and puts out credible bass. I wanted something wireless, that wouldn't take up a lot of space and could be put almost anywhere. This device fills the bill in every aspect. Cons: The only thing I didn't like was the black on black control buttons, it's difficult to see in low light situations. (This seems to be a trend on ALL things from ovens to car interiors)
customer_reviews.author: CountyCorkMan

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: After 5 months, all buttons on the speaker stop responding :( Don't waste your time and money on it!
customer_reviews.author: Ying Hu

customer_reviews.title: Works better than advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than advertised! Bought this wireless speaker to use in the shower. Didn't expect much beyond it working in a wet environment. To my surprise, it actually sounds good. I can listen to the news or music while I am in there without a problem. It was also very easy to connect it to my echo device. All in all, a good purchase. If you are looking for a portable speaker I would suggest you choose this one.
customer_reviews.author: William J Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound, not that loud
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in a lab at work with a lot of background noise. I have an Ontz Angle there now and couldn't hear it over the motors. This was was only slightly louder and any bass was badly distorted. I wasn't expecting deep bass, but I didn't expect it would rattle the speaker like the speaker was cracked. I have a Bose soundlink and it is vastly superior. I wasn't expecting this to be as good for half the price, but at least I expected it to be loud without rattles. Overall very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Sounds awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The speaker sounds absolutely amazing, considering it's price & size. I made the purchase based on other positive reviews, and they were spot on. It sounds WAY better than Alexa. I was also very pleasantly surprised with the overall quality "feel" of the speaker. It may be made in China, but it reminds me of Apple products. The only low quality items are the instruction sheet (nothing wrong with it, just flimsy sheet of paper), and the lanyard is just a shoestring tied in a loop. Who cares! The rest is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Chris K350

customer_reviews.title: Great quality sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: The sound is excellent. It doesn’t lose quality when you turn the volume max, and the bass is incredible. You can’t hear any vibration or noise. Tested with classical music, pop, rock, and those reggaeton songs that are exactly the same
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sound
customer_reviews.text: When my wife started using this in the kitchen I couldn’t believe the sound I herd out in the other room. It is really deep and rich like it’s coming from a surround system from the TV. I have actually looked at this speaker in amazement thinking how can all that sound come from this small speaker. I would recommend this to anyone. Great deal and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jin W

customer_reviews.title: Good Reviews were wrong!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this speaker the first week in January of 2019. It is April 10th and the speakers are so bad you can't really turn them up because of the distortion. I really liked this speaker and was super happy with my purchase until now. It got some good use. My kids used it playing basketball and I carried it around for chores. Really dissatisfied that it only made it a few months especially after all the good reviews. Of course Im outside the window for refund or return.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L. Bledsoe

customer_reviews.title: Overall a very nice speaker. Bluetooth worked fine
customer_reviews.text: Overall a very nice speaker. Bluetooth worked fine. But did not work for me. There is a definite lag time between YouTube video sound and the speaker. Very annoying and unacceptable. If it is to be used with music, will not be a problem (nothing to sync).
customer_reviews.author: Reg Mason

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: The sound was great for such a small speaker. So much so that I recommended it to a family member who bought one of for themselves. Unfortunately, after using it a 10-15 time in the few months I had it, it no longer works properly. Now whenever it is connected to a device, it only plays audio for 2-4 minutes before shutting itself off. This happens every time I try to use it now. Very frustrating. It went from being one of my favorite purchases to something I wish I hadn't purchased. No where near enough usage before running into problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After a few months, it stops working
customer_reviews.text: I thought I found a real gem of a bluetooth speaker. It sounds really good and feels heavy. The problem is that after 3 months of light use- twice a week for an hour or so during my workout- it went silent. It paid fine but won't play. I'm disappointed and will not buy an off brand bluetooth speaker again. Update:. Seller contacted me and gave me a full refund. In addition they are sending a replacement which is way more than I would have expected. Their customer service takes these reviews seriously and for that reason, I'm bumping my rating up to 3 star.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Moseley III

customer_reviews.title: Power button stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This speaker was so great. The sound was good, battery life was good and everything was fine for about 8 months. Then I started having trouble with the power button - I had to try 5-6 times to get it powered on or off. Ultimately the button stopped working after 11 months of using it. (Not a heavy usage - I use it once a week or so). What good is the speaker if it won't turn on. There is no way I could open it up - it's all sealed for water proofing.
customer_reviews.author: Arumugam Jeganathan

customer_reviews.title: Incredible for the price
customer_reviews.text: The tribit is an incredible bluetooth speaker. The sound was comparable to even my tronsmart. There is just no distortion in this one. The sound is balanced and crisp and had a lot of bluetooth speakers but this is the most portable AND best sounding on. Keyterms is portable and sounding. Usually you have one or the other. Last 24 hours and the range is phenomenal Only come are the lack of light up buttons but that may drain the battery more. It has no tf card and you can't charge your phone with it. These were not deal breakers so I was okay with that.
customer_reviews.author: AMC Supreme

customer_reviews.title: Cheap for a reason
customer_reviews.text: After less than 2 months of normal use the speaker has blown and has a rattle. Is now unusable. It’s cheap and now i know why. It also would not pair with Apple Watch.
customer_reviews.author: S. Foster

customer_reviews.title: The power cord doesnt fit the unit or adapter, resulting in no charge
customer_reviews.text: 1 star The power cord doesnt fit the unit or adapter, resulting in no charge Should have called the company up but didnt get around to using it till lately. Very frustrating. The power cord doesnt fit the unit or the adapter snugly, so it keeps falling out, so it wont play on either the battery charge or plugged in. Tried different adapters, cords. Finally put it aside. My advice is buy with caution and dont wait to test it like me. Wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought one off these and it works great, so much that I bought another one, as a wedding present, This is what she took out of the box! She wanted to say thank-you! Clearly after zooming I could see it was USED! I’m so embarrassed and want another one sent to their address! I certainly would have not even known without them texting me a picture! Bad Bad business!
customer_reviews.author: K Fisher

customer_reviews.title: You want this one
customer_reviews.text: This thing is remarkably good. I could say it's remarkably good for its eyes or for the price but let's put that aside. It just sounds great! The price and the size is just a bonus. Like any fine piece of audio gear, the better the music sounds the better it sounds. I've been playing lots of music through it but just played my show off playlist and it sounded remarkable. If you're looking at this you should buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: failed within 3 months and NO customer service
customer_reviews.text: Fine portable speaker, above average, but poor build quality and despite advertising an 18 month replacement warranty they simply don't reply to customer service requests - ie. no warranty at all. Ours simply stopped working with a solid light and completely unresponsive to even a hard reset - probably a bigger concern since that means it's likely the firmware that's failing and not a piece of hardware. Either way, this is a very competitive product area, you can certainly get on where the manufacturer has the reputation of standing by their products.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted...
customer_reviews.text: Have not even owned the Tribit XSound Go Bluetooth Speaker for 1 year, and the on/off button not longer works!!! It is covered with thick rubber, so there's no getting to it to fiddle with it without cutting the rubber. On the other hand, I have owned a Monster ClarityHD Precision Micro Bluetooth Speaker for 7 years, and it STILL works great. For convenience, I wanted speakers in 2 locations in my house. Now I'm back down to one, and $34.00 poorer :(
customer_reviews.author: V1 RO T8

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this speaker in June, so it hasn’t even lasted a year. It no longer holds a charge and won’t stay connected via Bluetooth. I’m disappointed in the longevity of these speakers... it’s not sustainable. I tried leaving it connected to the charger, but for whatever reason that doesn’t work either to keep it charged. Before it just stopped working completely, it held a charge for at least 8 hours and would stay idle for about 12.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Short-Life - Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: We've had three of these Tribit XSound Go. We liked the sound a lot. Unfortunately they have no durability. All three were used gently indoors - on tables - never dropped or any rough handling. After a few months one unit stopped working at all. After another few months the replacement unit sound suddenly garbled & distorted. Third unit power On/Off button has become so unreliable it takes minutes of pushing repeatedly to turn On or turn Off - too much trouble. None of these units were ever used outdoors. We have switched to JBL Flip 4 - seems much better so far -
customer_reviews.author: Lucchese

customer_reviews.title: To Good to Be True?  So Far, Unfortunately, Yes
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to love this speaker. Price is right, it feels nice to the touch, bluetooth interface works nicely, but I think it is blown after only four days of use. Bass hits give me a staticky sound, kind of crackling. Though maybe it was too loud. Turned it down. Same thing. Thought maybe it was the kind of music. Switched to more chill music and the same thing. Really bummed. I am going to see how to get in touch with the company and update from there. Other speakers I have used, including my trusty little Phillips that I have had for 5 years, will dial the bass down apparently if its too much. Maybe this speaker doesn't? IDK.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blew in only a few hours
customer_reviews.text: I had written a good review for this speaker but I have to update. It was good for a few uses with great sound but after about 2 hours of use the speakers are blown. Now even on a full charge it's rattling and sounds like a cheap Chinese speaker. I'm really disappointed. I initially thought this product was great but it didn't even last more than 2 hours of use. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: JSAT

customer_reviews.title: Decent speaker
customer_reviews.text: Sound is nice and bassy, definitely better for music over live audio/voice. OK size and weight. Bundled documentation claims Bluetooth 5.0, Amazon documentation says 4.2. Which is right? Seems more like 4.2 from profile obtained via Apple Bluetooth Explorer. Speakers do not display battery level despite other devices such as PowerBeats 3 displaying theirs. I know this is a lower priced SKU as far as Bluetooth speakers go but this is a glaring fault. How am I going to know when I should start charging it again, other than some annoying low battery beep?
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Clark

customer_reviews.title: Amazing low budget speaker with hi-fi sound
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Crisp clear well tuned sound at low to medium volumes and better sound than many speakers which are much more expensive Solid build quality and nice feel in the hands Good Battery life Attached lanyard gives a nice touch Cons: Struggles with some some heavier bass and drum tracks Looses bass rapidly at high volumes Overall: One of my favorite speakers. I grin every time I play this because it is amazing that a company can make a speaker of this sound quality for <$40. New low budget king for me, and one of my favorite of 18 Bluetooth speakers.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: This little thing ROCKS!
customer_reviews.text: What a bang for your buck! This thing really pumps out real LOUD to be so small. The bass and sound quality out of this little speaker Is truly unimaginable for it’s price range! Trust me!!! I am a musician and i have good ears, and i know great sound when i listen to music. I was just looking for a small Bluetooth speaker to take with me on the go outside when hanging with some friends and this speaker does more then i expected. I wasn’t really expecting such amazing sound from a cheap little speaker. Yes i just had to say cheap! Lol... I’m very happy and pleased!🙂
customer_reviews.author: Chad-RIP🙏

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: I've had this item for maybe two years and it suddenly stopped working on my laptop. I've tried uninstalling it several times, resetting it several times had it replaced and still won't work. The manufacturer says they can only help me by email, they won't help me by phone. I'm good with computers but I'm not an expert. I've done everything they've told me by email. I need to have a tech talk to me on the phone to see if everything is in order on my laptop for this bluetooth device but they won't do it. This thing is useless to me. Find a different Mfg if you need a speaker like this.
customer_reviews.author: Old Grey Beard

customer_reviews.title: RIP little speaker
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a UE mini boom for 10 years and thought I needed a spare so I got this on the lightening deals they always have. It’s bigger than the mini boom And heavier and I didn’t use it much until one day it got the chance to go to the beach with me after being freshly charge and it died after 3 months and maybe three uses. If that weren’t bad enough then it wouldn’t charge again at all and so I’m throwing it away. And that was just after I bought my daughter one for Xmas because I thought it was kinda cool. Hope hers lasts a little o her than three months.
customer_reviews.author: Mac/Cheese

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!!
customer_reviews.text: My brand new Tribit XSound Go simply would not play music! power on, battery charged, all other devices removed, bluetooth paired to my laptop... no sound! tried all the obvious turn off/on, disconnect/ reconnect bluetooth, tried every suggestion in the manual, comment boards, even Tribit's own customer service... nothing. apparently this speaker has great sound, but i wouldnt know... in my experience it doesnt make any sound whatsoever! buyer beware!!! PS - $35 ceases to be a value when you factor in multiple days of troubleshooting & returns!!! JBL here i come!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Ritzius

customer_reviews.title: Pause/skip/previous button doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Pause/skip/previous button didn't work. I addressed to the seller and tried it multiple times after resetting the speakers, but no luck. When listening to your playlists from, like Amazon Music and YouTube, the pause/skip (press twice)/previous (previous three times) button does work at all. Overall, the sound quality was pretty good considering its size, but the User Manual indicated that the speakers are two, 5-watt, and not 6-watt as it described on website. I'm going to try it again by returning and purchasing another one hoping that the issue will be no longer present. I will return in few days to offer my updated review (this certainly is 4 stars or higher if I didn't encounter such a problem).
customer_reviews.author: Paul Jo

customer_reviews.title: Died After a Year
customer_reviews.text: Loved this speaker when it worked. Primarily used it attached to my backpack while riding my bike around town. Unfortunately the battery stopped holding a charge and the unit is completely bricked now. Going to look at other options that should last longer. Updated Review: I upgraded to 4 stars considering the excellent customer service I've received from Tribit. They addressed the issue and offered a couple of acceptable solutions. I really appreciate the few companies that still focus on the customer experience.
customer_reviews.author: cdslax14

customer_reviews.title: Handy in my Shop
customer_reviews.text: Could not get good reception on my portable radio when I worked in my basement. This speaker works great with my Iphone.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Terrible longevity/build quality.
customer_reviews.text: I was initially very pleased with the sound quality and battery life of this speaker, especially given the price. As some other reviews have mentioned, the speaker began to rattle, first with bass-heavy music, but gradually increasing until all content now sounds like an FM station with crappy reception. This despite the fact that the speaker was never taken out of the house and not played at the upper limits of its volume. You usually get what you pay for, and this is an example of cutting corners in the wrong places.
customer_reviews.author: B. Didier

customer_reviews.title: Easy pairing, perfect sound for office
customer_reviews.text: Paired and repairs very quickly with my iPhone. This little speaker puts out really nice sound for the size and is perfect for my office. I picked up a micro USB wall wart to power it away from my laptop to keep the desk a little tidier. Below is a link to the type of power supply I used.
customer_reviews.author: Deeve

customer_reviews.title: No distortion
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I have made on Amazon in the past year. Absolutely an outstanding value. In my listening, it has a balanced, full sound. There is absolutely no distortion at any volume level. I purchased after watching several video posts by clavinetjunkie, who is an excellent reviewer of budget bluetooth speakers. According to him and to Wirecutter, this is your best budget option. After listening to them myself, I could not agree more. Buy it for yourself or gift it to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: DrStock

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great....
customer_reviews.text: This speaker is only good for singing along in the shower. I took it to work and no one could really hear it unless they were right in front of it. It was on full volume too. I was told it was already upgraded with the latest but im not so sure if it was and i dont have time to do that especially if you have to buy a seperate tranfer cable. No thank you. Its a good speaker but only for at your place while doing chores. Not recommended for work. Returned. Sorry, i really wanted to love this.
customer_reviews.author: The Garrisons

customer_reviews.title: Overall great little speaker. Treat yourself!
customer_reviews.text: Great little speaker. Audio cuts out on occasion if the volume of the material playing is too low, but I experienced this with another brand as well, so perhaps that's common. Other than that, I'm very pleased with the sound, loudness capability, and with how lightweight it is. The wrist strap really comes in handy when toting a lot of things at once. I definitely recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: LindyLouWho

customer_reviews.title: The speaker is a good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Speaker is what you should expect for the price and it works great. Had a few Bluetooth issues (but replacement speaker fixed that issue) and the battery is just ok. But, happy with what I got for the price. UPDATE: Tribit reached out due to this review and is sending me a replacement speaker. Didn't expect that and happy to see if it is just my speaker that has been an issue?! Update 2: Adding another start after getting a replacement speaker. No more Bluetooth issues and sound quality actually seems a little better on the new one.
customer_reviews.author: craig coglianese

customer_reviews.title: Started out great. Quickly went downhill.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use in my classroom. Was able to pair quickly. Audio worked great for my needs (low music playing as students are working). Started using in February and by the end of March I can no longer pair it with my phone. Have tried resetting and nothing seems to work. When I can pair it, it works for about 2 minutes and shuts off. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RyanE

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a little over 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd speaker that I purchased. The first one is working fine. This one died about 2 weeks after using it daily. Customer service responded very quickly to my review and offered me a full refund or a replacement speaker. I chose the replacement speaker and it works fine unless a song is playing with deep bass and then the speaker crackles a bit. There customer service followed up with me and this and quickly offered me a full refund. My first speaker still works fine and I'm happy about that.
customer_reviews.author: techsus

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Quality made and so small that I am amazed that such a great sound comes from it. Granted, the sound wont fill an auditorium but I only want it for music in my kitchen, or when I'm outside gardening and things like that. I just love it and the sound is just beautiful! The sound is strong! Great product and easy to use. I have an android cell phone and it just takes one wire to connect and boom- great sound!
customer_reviews.author: francyn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: [Update 10/18/20: Sadly, I can't recommend this product. This is the second unit I've received that simply will not charge no matter how long it's plugged in. When it works it's fantastic, but that's only as long as the charge it comes with. Although I received this six weeks ago the return window is closed and I'm not going to spend money in the hope that the third time will be the charm. Many other buyers have reported the same issue so I'll put it down to quality control.] The sound is fantastic and it easily pairs with multiple sources. It uses a USB-C connector to charge, which is a plus for me. Battery life could be longer.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H.

customer_reviews.title: One Hundred Percent Premium
customer_reviews.text: This speaker screams quality and is 100% premium. I purchased this for my sister during a "Lightning Deal" and she is more than satisfied with it. Solid, loud, appealing, and high quality. Linked easily with a Samsung Android phone and several other devices. Bluetooth was instant on all devices. Sound quality is awesome and easily fills a family room. Packaging was nice. Not overdone but still appealing. I believe we'll get another one to link together for stereo sound. I highly recommend this for just about anybody looking for good sound in a compact package.
customer_reviews.author: steve-o

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: We've had the product for over a year and used it on the beach, in the backyard and I'll take it in the garage while lifting weights -- perfect. Sound is excellent, IMHO, for a speaker of this size. There was a minor issue with charging the product around 12.5 months after purchasing. I contacted their support team via email (available on their website) and received an immediate response, recommendations on troubleshooting and after it was confirmed the micro-USB cord could have an issue, they sent an immediate replacement. Would definitely buy again and recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Jack

customer_reviews.title: Small but loud!
customer_reviews.text: It's soo little! But the bass is impressive and the sound is almost as good as my Bose Color SoundLink at less than half the price. The cord that comes with it is really short so I've already dropped it twice while charging it and it just bounces and goes on like nothing happened. Super easy to pair fine for the technologically challenged. Can't say enough good things about this little guy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Erin Vehring

customer_reviews.title: Has good sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Have not yet tested battery life, so 5 stars may be high. Anyway, the only complaint I have with this device seems to be a common theme for me. It's black, ok, but that means the controls are black as well. It's hard to see the controls in low light. Heck, it's hard to see without a light shinning directly on it. Trivial maybe, but when you get older, you'll appreciate well designed, easily seen controls.
customer_reviews.author: Tony P. Sr

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sound for its size!
customer_reviews.text: True about the rich bass, which is a sound I like. It weighs more than I expected it to weigh, but maybe that's how it manages to produce such great sound. I use it primarily to play streaming music from my cellphone, via Pandora. Volume controls are easy to use, Bluetooth works flawlessly anywhere inside my house, and if you want it loud, this little speaker can do that too. Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: danay

customer_reviews.title: Rich Bass???  Not really.
customer_reviews.text: Just like my review of their Stormbox, where's the "Rich Bass?" I started with this speaker and it was kind of tinny. Not really engulfing with "Rich Bass." So then I ordered their "Stormbox." Same thing. Compared the two to each other and not a big difference. Also had a couple other speakers to compare it to, a "Blackweb" which sounds fabulous, but can't find that model anywhere. And another high end speaker that is a friends, (can't remember the name right now). It sounded like the Tribit was struggling to keep up. It felt solid, great Bluetooth connectivity, but just not the robust sound I'm looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: XSound Go vs. XSound Surf
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't decide between the XSound Go and XSound Surf and ordered both. After testing both next to each other, I can definitely say that the XSound Go sounds much better especially at higher volumes. So even though this is a bit more expensive, I kept the XSound Go and returned the Surf. Its a good speaker for under $30 price range. The Bluetooth range is not much and definitely not what is advertised. I would say 20-25 ft max. Have only used it for 2-3 days so can't say much about battery or other things yet. I'll update it later if something comes up.
customer_reviews.author: Deal-Dude

customer_reviews.title: Small, but decent sound.
customer_reviews.text: I usually take this out when sitting in my backyard. It sounds great. From many of past posts I have read on various speakers I realize that there are many folks looking for that perfect sound. This is probably not for you. The sound is very good and I am happy with it, but if you want an exemplary sounding speaker, you will have to pay much more.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but not durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this speaker last September. I was pretty impressed with the sound coming from this little speaker. Really good bass. But less than a year after, I started noticing a grating sound coming from the speaker when music is paying. As if it were nasally congested. This entirely ruins the device. Not sure if it’s just a bad lemon unit. I thought I found the perfect brand. But if their speakers can’t hold out more than a few months, there’a no point. Update: customer service quickly got back to me and shipped a replacement unit. Bumping my rating for stellar customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Chef

customer_reviews.title: A great speaker at a great price
customer_reviews.text: What a great find! I wanted a portable bluetooth speaker that had great sound quality but that didn't cost a fortune. Skimming through the search results, I was bummed to see that none of the "good", "reputable" brands offered a truly inexpensive option. Then I happened upon a review of this Tribit speaker that rated it very highly and a great value at ~$35. Well, I could not be more pleased – the sound quality is excellent and so is its bluetooth connectivity. And I'm rather amazed at the long battery life. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement
customer_reviews.text: I had gotten a Beats pill several years ago on a black Friday sale. I used it exclusively in my garage but it quit working. I like having music in my garage/shop when I'm working so I needed something else quick. I didn't have the money for anything expensive so I got this. This speaker is a great replacement and I'm glad I took the chance on it.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: After about 2 months of use the speakers started rattling, bad vibration sounds like excessive bass. there are no adjustments to add bass or trebble so the speakers are trash!!!! Will never purchase one of these speakers again!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm no audiophile- I just wanted a speaker to use with my Kindle so I could listen to music. This was the first to pop up in my search and I'm glad it did. It seemed to have great reviews and I can see..or hear why. The sound is amazing! I can feel the base when I touch the speaker-the sound is clear and clean. The speaker is solid and well made. So portable with a strap. And best of all, affordable. It easily synced with my Kindle-nothing for me to do but make sure my Kindle and the speaker were turned on. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura J.

customer_reviews.title: was AWESOME for about 14  months, then connection & batter issues (but warranty is great!)
customer_reviews.text: I was totally satisfied with the might and durability of this little speaker for the last year+ but in the last month i've had a lot of charging and connection issues. It seemed pretty abrupt too! Which was a bummer. I was really happy with this guy while it lasted and the price point is pretty good. Fortunately it should still be under warranty? So we'll see if I that process is easy. I'd love for it to last a least a few years but maybe the price point was too good to be true. I'll update when I know more re: warranty !
customer_reviews.author: fabienne

customer_reviews.title: Best Bluetooth speaker under $50
customer_reviews.text: First let me say that tribit stands behind their products 100%..I had a charging issue with one of my xsound go speaker and it was replaced immediately with no questions ask now that's what I call a great company and customer service..as for the speaker it's built well and looks great I compared this speaker with other brands like Anker and they were no match in my opinion..the quality of sound that comes from this speaker you would think it cost way more..for the price and what you get there's nothing out there at the moment just get one you won't be disappointed..
customer_reviews.author: Welly

customer_reviews.title: Second one works great, first one lasted 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: I was contacted by the company with the offer of a replacement, which I’ve received. It works great and I really like it. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is that my first one broke after 9 months. I’ll post an update after I’ve had it for awhile to see if it holds up. Good sound in the shower. Original Review: The sounds is good and the battery life is decent, while it lasted. I primarily used it in the shower. Worked well for 9 months and then it stopped working and wouldn’t charge. Disappointed that it didn’t last. Think of this speaker as temporary and a throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great little speaker
customer_reviews.text: This speaker has good sound for so small of a box, but don't expect booming bass. It's just physically not possible in such a small speaker. Don't get me wrong--I like the speaker and would recommend it. The battery lasts forever and it has decent sound. But I have to counter some of the reviews that say it has great bass. If you want a small, inexpensive, good quality Bluetooth speaker then this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: SPEAKER IS TOO GOOD FOR ITS LOW PRICE
customer_reviews.text: This little speaker is amazing. The one drawback is that it takes up to 6 hours to charge. That being said, the bass has an amazing presence. The mids are great and the highs also. It’s portability is a great feature and although I have not had a chance to prove the waterproof feature, I can say that dust and sand cause it no issues as I had it at the beach with me all summer. This speaker IS WAY TOO GOOD FOR ITS LOW PRICE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joebobhst

customer_reviews.title: if you would like to, lol~ now I could enjoy my musics ...
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and portable with reasonable price, also could be very loud, if you would like to, lol~ now I could enjoy my musics without limitation of wires, ye~
customer_reviews.author: Elvzp

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and good volume at a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 3 of these now. The first was for myself, then 2 gifts. They sound great, last a long time, and have more volume than you'd suspect. I liked them so much I bought the more expensive versions, which are even better. But if you're looking for inexpensive sound around the house (TV, computer or phone) or just something good to take with you as you travel, nothing beats this speaker. Others have in-depth reviews you can check out, so I'll just say that I'm on my 7th Tribit now and have never had a complaint from anyone I've given one to.
customer_reviews.author: Des

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good Little Device
customer_reviews.text: We got the Tribit for listening to music in our garden, which is abuts a very busy street. There's a slight push to the midrange, which makes vocals sound especially present, and when we listen to jazz, you can totally hear (if not feel, obviously) the bass players. Most of the rest of my kit is of the insufferable audiophile nerd variety, but this little guy punches way above his weight, and the price is beyond right. High fidelity on a busy city street is besides the point, but this allows us to enjoy our music with surprising clarity while not annoying the neighbors. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: DKR

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: One of the most affordable quality speakers I have found. I have taken this speaker all over with me and everywhere I go people love it and ask me where I got it. My nephew who is 16 even tried to steal it from me. Definitely worth the money. It does base well and has impressive sound quality while still being portable. It was easy to connect to via blue tooth. The batter life is great lasting days before I need to recharge it. I actually got two. One for my room and one for my car which has an old sound system.
customer_reviews.author: June Moon

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound & Always Connects
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome little speaker for $32. Wow, really impressive sound. I bought it to listen to talk radio mostly while working out in the yard and it's perfect, nice and clear and if you want to crank up some music it's very respectable. You can use it as a two-way for phone calls, that's not the best as it's a little echo'y for the other caller to hear, i didn't buy it for that but it does work ok'ish. Bluetooth connects super fast, battery life is good, I can go about 3 days (on/off 10hrs day) before i have to charge. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth speaker that doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Tribit in June of 2018. I have only used it sporadically. Now the battery doesn't keep it's charge and most recently I have not been able to pair it with other devices. I would not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: 2nd purchase disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd purchase. I loved the first one. Sound was amazing for such a small device but after two years i guess the charging port went through it. However this second. OMG the sound on it SUCKS to the max. Its nowhere as loud as my first and I really don't have any use for it. I'm hurt. But I guess i'm gonna have to find another Bluetooth speaker. I tried to give it some time, i'm thinking maybe its the apps or my phone. I went back to the first one and it still works great. This second one really disappointed me because I could have bought another one I was considering.
customer_reviews.author: YaYa

customer_reviews.title: talk about DANCEPARTY
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly! This set of speakers has led to plenty-a danceparty at my household! Albeit, it's just me, but sometimes my dog joins in. Maybe my neighbors do too, but they haven't said anything. This thing is uuber portable and convenient. (side note- the charger also charges my dog's day-glo light stick necklace, keeping her safe at night) I haven't actually super tested out the waterproofability of it, but it's held shower danceparties for me so it seems up for the challenge - wayyyymoreso than my phone. These badboys have blasted jams out of my sunroom while I do yardwork, aint no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Blabigail

customer_reviews.title: Awesome portable speaker
customer_reviews.text: We'd been using a cheapo BEM cube portable speaker for a while and decided to upgrade. Was comparing this to Anker, Oontz, Monoprice. After reading CNET's review decided to give it a whirl. This speaker is awesome, I am very impressed with the sound quality and clarity from this little guy. Tried it a hight volume levels and there is no distortion and voices don't sound nasaly. At this price point and for the value this thing rocks. Would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great, inexpensive portable speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Sujit

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service and Quick Response To Issue With Speaker
customer_reviews.text: Update 11/27/19: Tribit has great customer service they contacted me immediately about my speaker issues. They offered me the option to get a refund or replacement. I opted for the replacement since I really did like this speaker. I got the new speaker within a couple days. New speaker is working great will update if it has same issue. Previous review: I did love this speaker. Great battery life, good Bluetooth connectivity, and solid sound and bass for the price. But after 3 1/2 months the Bluetooth has issues connecting. It will say connected but doesn’t play music. When it is actually playing music the music is distorted and vibrating. I hardly ever move the speaker.
customer_reviews.author: LHDC33

customer_reviews.title: Sound cuts out during silent periods; dialogue interrupted.
customer_reviews.text: It seems that during even brief periods of audio silence the unit enters a sleep mode to conserve battery energy. When input resumes it does not start up quickly enough, which causes interruption of playback, particularly while listening to human speech. Because of this behavior, this Bluetooth speaker was useless for listening to a podcast. Also, without audio input it shuts down completely after only a short while, forcing me to repetitively turn it back on. The only good thing about this product is the sound quality. It is very good, the best I've heard from a small speaker. It would serve well for listening to music that does not have silent moments.
customer_reviews.author: qed

customer_reviews.title: Best Budget BT Speaker I've used
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of Bluetooth speakers over the last couple years. Usually this is for shower and/or traveling for me (beach, lakes, etc...). Waterproof, awesome bass from this little guy, small so very portable, great battery life. Bluetooth can sometimes be annoying with which phone it happens to default to, but you work through that, and it's typical with every BT speaker I've ever used. All in all, this is the best one, at an amazing price. My first one blew a speaker (I guess I was going to hard w/ some heavy bass music!!!) - and I contacted tribit, who replaced it for me for free. Great customer service puts this to an easy 5 stars for me.
customer_reviews.author: Solo

customer_reviews.title: Good for listening to news in the shower.
customer_reviews.text: I've had difficulty finding such a speaker that doesn't overdrive and muddy the low end and sacrifice mids and highs. While this is just a small speaker - I use it in the shower - I can still understand the newscasters that I listen to. I've learned that the hard surfaces in the bathroom do amplify the bass, so keep this in mind when looking for a bathroom speaker. The biggest problem is that it doesn't reliably and consistently connect to my echo automatically. Sometimes it connects by just turning it on, other times I have to tell Alexa to connect to my speaker.
customer_reviews.author: S. Epstein

customer_reviews.title: Great compact speaker with big sound
customer_reviews.text: This Tribit XSoundGo Bluetooth speaker has a great frequency range for a compact and inexpensive speaker. There may be better ones out there, but I am very satisfied with the fidelity of this speaker. It has a full sound with lows , midranges, and trebles along with good clarity and resonance. If you are just looking to fill a single room with ample volume and quality fidelity, this is the speaker for you. On the other hand, if you are looking to fill a huge space or to annoy your neighbors when in the backyard, this may not be the speaker for you. Overall, it is well worth the money as long as you are realistic about its capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Blackmore

customer_reviews.title: You’re not paying for good speakers
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line: you’re paying for a solid waterproof housing, not good sound. I bought this for my garage/gym and outdoor work. Sound quality is only okay and gets worse as you turn it up. Quite or loud the mid range is boosted so much that vocals drown out everything else. It can be loud if pointing at you, but it does not fill even a small room. Mine does not have very good Bluetooth range either and more than once has disconnected when the phone is right next to it. On the plus side it is built pretty solid and the battery does last. Maybe it will be good for the beach, but I wouldn’t know because COVID...
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker (Update)
customer_reviews.text: Great little speaker.. Long battery life, great sound, easy connects to Bluetooth. This is my third little speaker, the others were junk... Update: so I’ve owned this speaker for about a year and I really like it. Great bass, overall sound is very clear and loud. Recently, the plug in the back of the speaker became loose making it difficult to maintain a charge. I wrote a quick note to Tribit asking about repair options and to my surprise and delight, they responded immediately and offered to send me a new speaker! This is a wonderful company with excellent and exceptional customer support! I can’t recommend them enough!
customer_reviews.author: Drneedle

customer_reviews.title: Sound is ok but range is not so great.
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my garage when working or washing my vehicle and it starts to cut out when I get more than about 25feet from the speaker with anything between me and the speaker so I usually just lay the my phone next to it. The sound is good at lower volume, but when you turn it up very loud it starts to sound "tinny". For the price, it's not too bad, but if you want quality sound I would consider one of the more expensive speakers. I also own the JBL Charge 3 and that one has great sound and great range, but it's also 3x the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: A Keeper
customer_reviews.text: I saw this reviewed as a budget Bluetooth portable speaker and for 20 bucks I thought I could not go wrong. I grabbed it on a flash sale and it is incredibly powerful and clear. I couldn’t be happier. The size is great if you wanna carry it around as a personal speaker but don’t let the sizeDissuade you from picking up this little gem. I have to say I am pleasantly surprised and it’s a keeper. I liked it so much I went back to grab one for my daughter but the price bumped back up to $30 so I’ll wait till it comes back on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Always Summer Here

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Speaker
customer_reviews.text: I listen to podcasts while in the kitchen or cleaning and this a great little speaker to carry room to room with me. I also bought one for my sister who has AMD and has been listening to books instead of reading (one of her great pleasures taken away) and she uses it a lot, as well. Music sounds great over it, too.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S

customer_reviews.title: WAY better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: So easy to connect. VERY SOLID sound. For an economical little speaker - this thing cranks our the music! I’m quite impressed. I only wanted a cheapy speaker, like 1-2 steps up from my phone speaker. This thing could probably supply sound to my (smaller) backyard for an informal gathering. The SINGULAR downside - it didn’t come with its own power block. I’m always hesitant to share blocks because I don’t want to end up causing damage if I use a block too powerful for the item. Well worth the nice price.
customer_reviews.author: Lazycrazyjen

customer_reviews.title: Great unit for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift, but I did hear it play, it connected immediately and streamed music as intended. Person I bought it for really seemed to like it. If i could change anything on it, it'd be better and more visible controls, very difficult to see in low light. Lighted controls would be better or at least white symbols to stand out against the black speaker. Other than that, well worth the money and you can't go wrong. I bought myself a OontZ unit which in my opinion is much better, but that's a different review.
customer_reviews.author: TJB63

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and good price on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This excellent speaker is $10 more at Walmart than it is on Amazon. The sound quality compares very well with any high-priced Bose portable speaker. I listen to a broad range of music but primarily classical stuff. The speaker is only 6 3⁄4 long and 2 1⁄2 inches wide. It has a solid feel about it. the audio is neither tinny nor muddy. It is simply well-balanced. I was pleasantly surprised that such a quality product could be purchased for only $27. I use it paired to my desktop computer because it takes up such a small amount of real estate on my cluttered desk, and of course no wires get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Negri

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: The speaker actually sounds pretty good for $30. The problem is that there is a rattle for certain types of bass that ruins the song. Not heavy bass, just a certain type. Maybe something is loose inside. Update: Tribit customer service contacted me and quickly remedied the situation. Great experience.
customer_reviews.author: psalms8318

customer_reviews.title: Emphasized Mids, Sufficient Bass
customer_reviews.text: I compared this side by side with an Oontz Angle 3 Ultra listening to spoken voice (NPR news), classical (orchestra and solo piano), and rock (Yes live Roundabout). I prefer this Tribit. It offers a more clarion sound overall. Its bass, while relative muted, is present and not at all boomy (like the Oontz). Has an onboard mic (which I did not test). Includes audio jack but you'll need to buy the 3.5 male/male cable separately if wanting to connect without using Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Windrum

customer_reviews.title: INFURIATING. Drops out randomly when using AUX.
customer_reviews.text: This speaker sounds alright, I'll give it that. However, I frequently line devices that don't have bluetooth in via 1/8" jack...and the speaker cuts out ALL THE TIME when the music gets quiet. It's like it decides there's no sound coming through, so it just stops working. Bizarre, and kind of a deal-breaker for me. Why would this even be a feature? Lame.
customer_reviews.author: Kellryan

customer_reviews.title: Good budget pick
customer_reviews.text: If you have the funds, buy the Tribit MaxBoom—the sound really is better. But this is a good budget pick. Pros: -small and portable -connects easily via bluetooth -doesn't have siri, alexa, or other voice recognition built in (I find them creepy, sorry) -Good volume range Cons: -I have found the bluetooth connection to be glitchy if I am doing other things on my computer while playing music (maybe this is a computer issue, but I don't know for sure) -Sound is notably tinnier than the MaxBoom, though not at all bad for the price
customer_reviews.author: Persephone

product_meta.title: Tribit XSound Go Bluetooth Speaker - Speakers Bluetooth Wireless with Rich Bass, IPX7 Waterproof, 12W Powerful Sound, 24H Playtime, Portable Speaker with Built-in Mic & 66 ft Bluetooth Range, Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black

Tribit - Pump Up the Party with a Blast of Good Beats

Smaller Size, Bigger Sound
Don't let its compact size fool you -- The Tribit XSound Go provides sound that's larger than life. Dual 6W high-performance drivers and a premium passive bass radiator create soaring highs, electrifying mids, and rich bass. Your music will be smooth and clear, even when cranked to maximum volume!

Incredible 24 Hour Playtime
No outlet? No problem. A powerful, rechargeable lithium ion battery offers up to 24 hours of non-stop use. It's the perfect speaker for traveling, camping trips, barbecues, or anywhere else you might need a little ambience.

Take Your Tunes on the Road
At only 13oz, this featherlight portable speaker is easy to carry from place to place. Throw it in your backpack, purse, or beach bag for music on the go. We've also attached a convenient carrying strap for maximum portability.

Pool Party Waterproof
With top of the line IPX7 waterproofing, water won't slow you down. It's perfect for the pool, the shower, the backyard, and everywhere in between.

Wireless Bluetooth Connection
Advanced bluetooth 4.2 technology provides a completely wireless connection with an amazing 66ft range! Pairing is simple -- Just enter your device's bluetooth settings, click on "Tribit XSound Go", and enjoy.

Universal Compatibility
The Tribit XSound Go is compatible with all bluetooth enabled devices. Pair it with your iPhone, Samsung, Amazon Echo/ Echo Dot, laptop and so much more. A 3.5 mm audio cable (not included) can be used to play audio from desktop computers, TVs, MP3 players.

Satisfaction Guaranteed
Here at Tribit, we are committed to providing the highest quality products on the market. That's why we protect your purchase with an 18 month replacement warranty, a 30 day money back guarantee and lifetime customer support.
feature_bullets: KILLER AUDIO: With crystal highs, crisp mids and rich bass, XSound Go creates an immersive listening experience unlike any other. State of the art bass radiators and dual 6W power drivers deliver shocking sound without distortion even at maximum volume.
EXTREME WATERPROOFING: Pool parties? Definitely. Lounging on the beach? Absolutely. Singing in the shower? You bet! This waterproof speaker is perfect for all sorts of summer fun.

SLEEK & SOPHISTICATED: XSound Go is as stylish as they come. Curved edges and a matte finish offer a modern touch, the compact design maximizes portability. Toss it in a backpack, stick in in your purse, or carry it around with the attached strap.

ALL DAY PLAY: Keep the music pumping all day (and all night) long. The powerful lithium ion battery guarantees up to 24 hours of continuous use! You'll be able to enjoy your favorite songs whenever (and wherever) you please.

WIRELESS CONNECTION: Don't let cords tie you down. Premium bluetooth 4.2 technology effortlessly connects to all of your bluetooth-enabled devices up to 66ft range. Press and hold the multifunction button to access the voice input for Siri and Google Now.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars11,257 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #18 in Portable Bluetooth Speakers#235 in MP3 & MP4 Player Accessories
